file_content.text: Me too. The harder, the better.
These c--c--controls are all that keeps the beasts in check.
Without them, they would savage us in a h--h--heartbeat.
Do not expect me to take your word for--ah, it seems you provide a means of testing after all.
You...!
I'm not taking the fall for you.
You failed, Jela.
Come peacefully, and I'll leave you to the mercy of the Voss.
Surrender!
You? Who's run from Rogun like a r--r--rat through half the galaxy, think you can f--face me?
I will leave you to rot! Rogun's r--r--rewards mean nothing now. I have found a power mere c--criminals can only dream of!
This ends now!
Die, scum! [Attack Jela]
Attack, my p--p--pets! She will see what lives within the darkness!
Get him, my p--p--pets! Let him see what lies within the Dark Heart!
It is t--t--time! Return to me im--m--mediately.
Lord Wratchen comes t--t--tonight to Lab 68. I p--promised him a demonstration of the powers we have tapped before we f--f--finalize our deal.
With this sale, the S--Sith armies will be invincible... and I will be the richest woman in h--history!
Here after all... and I already went and set up another buyer. I assumed you were dead on the trail somewhere.
This is my partner. We call him "Gormak Zak." He's our pipeline for the precious little beasties.
You have the stink of the Voss on you.
You look pretty human to me.
You're a Gormak?
He's... how do I put this delicately? Gone native. Poor dear doesn't talk to real people much anymore.
Quite an operation... you working with anyone else on Voss?
It's just you two?
Zak's... what's a polite way to say it? Gone native. Lives with the Gormak.
Not much for conversation, Gormak, but they can stick a remote control in a rancor's head like nobody's business.
The Gormak are this world's rightful rulers.
Let me handle this, dear.
So, I hardly know what to charge. You're our first client who didn't pay the markup to have the cargo shipped to him.
Let's start haggling.
Name your price.
Are you willing to pay... with your life?
I like a challenge.
[Flirt] I'm that kind of guy.
But I always come out on top. Which is more than I can say for you.
Why do I get the feeling we're not flirting anymore?
What are you talking about?
I like a woman who takes charge.
[Flirt] Tell me more.
Because you don't have the brains to do it yourself.
I'll send Rogun your head as a gift.
You're dead. [Attack Jela]
Who else do you sell to?
Do you have many buyers?
Trying to learn our trade secrets? Or maybe you know perfectly well....
I'm shutting you down.
Show's over. [Attack Jela]
Rogun's operation stops here!
You die now! [Attack them]
You think I'm fool enough not to recognize Rogun's top bounty?
I'm not making the mistake of taking you on one-on-one.
But when the Voss commandos find you here trading in abominations, I'm sure they'll be happy to pitch in.
Captain! Commandos targeting your location.
Turn yourself in.
They can determine your intentions.
You want Rogun the Butcher to keep trading in abominations? You want me to take the fall for his crimes?
So the real criminals escape?
Only outsiders would make one pick between the guilty.
You would... evade the commandos?
Tell the truth and accept their mercy.
I'm sorry I tried to go it alone. If you want to stop Rogun from helping the Gormak, we have to work together.
I need your help.
I don't know about Voss, but every cop I've met will take an arrest in the hand.
Would they believe me?
You came to trade in abominations. By law, you are guilty.
They speak of an informant who sent them.
That blasted hairball set me up.
Jela called them.
She would trade in abominations, then draw commandos?
Now you're catching on.
We call it a frame job. A setup. Taking the fall....
Yes.
Would. Did. Done.
It's cute how surprised you look. No wonder Rogun thinks Voss is such a gold mine.
I need to escape before the commandos find me.
Help me get out of here.
I will not lie.
The real criminals are Jela Reneke and Gormak Zak.
Tell them I'm innocent.
You say.
If you want to stop Rogun from helping the Gormak, we have to work together.
I'm sorry.
The Mystics teach that all quarrels can be mended with a word.
I'll tell them you knew I was buying Gormak abominations and willingly helped.
Help me or I'll drag you down.
Outsider!
Don't be an idiot, Captain. This guy's our lifeline!
Maybe we should be a little nicer, Captain? He doesn't seem like such a bad guy....
Rogun is the enemy. We should not fight.
You waste time, Captain. Forget your pride and beg the aid we need.
The captain's not so good at begging. That's why he has me. Please, please, please, help us! You know we're innocent. How do we get out of here?
I dislike being threatened. But being thought guilty....
You can explain the truth....
No. With this evidence, I would not listen to an outsider cry innocence.
Hold off the commandos, and I'll root out this Gormak smuggling ring.
Help me and I'll help you.
This was set up by Gormak sympathizers--does it serve Voss to let them get away?
Jela's the one they want.
The evidence is strong. It will take months for adjudicators to sort the truth....
If I give you time, you must use it to hunt these outlaws.
These outsiders should not aid Gormak while you face their punishment.
The commandos don't scare me.
Kill a Voss and your innocence does not matter.
Leave. That passage will take you to the trail.
I will tell the commandos the truth I know. Await me in Scratch's shop.
